narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: omg i loved this class and i hope she will come back and teach or someone else can pick up the content because it was great
I learned a ton about health+fitness
I learned tons about sex, gender, exercise movements, bodily autonomy, and wellness.
I developed skills in critically analyzing texts (both historical & modern) and discussing texts with peers.
Great course!
Historical background regarding sport and fitness

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: sometimes in the seminar you feel like you can't get to share your opinion but the professor was very open to comments on how to improve the course
Strengths were the discussion and a lot of the readings were good; also the prof!

Strengths: The readings were super interesting, we even we had access to texts that were not published yet. She also assigned podcasts, which made the workload a bit more bearable. The weekly reading reflections were a great, low-stakes way to practice analytical writing skills and prepare for the class discussions.

Weaknesses: This is no fault to the professor (or anyone else), but there were students who refused to really engage with the course materials. They clearly did not do the readings, but still decided to participate in class discussions uniformed, they were not open to changing their beliefs and often seemed to intentionally miss the entire point. This unfortunately, took away from the seminar experience. On the other hand, there were some students who spoke a lot, not allowing others to really share their opinions. This could be improved by Professor Ware setting a 'rule' for students to make sure they are not speaking over anyone -- or just by saying things like "if you have already spoken please allow your classmates a chance to share."

The class was very engaging and we always had really interesting conversations. The environment was open to diverse perspectives and although people were passionate to share their ideas, they were very willing to listen and give everyone the chance to speak.
Bit less readings
My favorite yale course i have ever taken

Strengths: great teacher, good course structure and format, variety in assignments, interesting readings

Weaknesses: none

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes i would
Yes, it is super interesting
Absolutely! I don't think Madeleine is going to teach it again, but it was a really fun class to take and I learned so much about myself and the atmosphere surrounding sports in general.

I would absolutely recommend this course to another student. It completely changed my perspective on sex, gender, and sport. I learned so much and had to opportunity to write about and discuss important topics.
Yes, i've never seen a class at Yale that combines all of these subjects, so this class was a really unique experience.
Yes!
100%. I learned so much and truly enjoyed going to this class every week
Yes, great course if you are even mildly interested in how cultural norms in sport and fitness came to be
